title: mxfwzzwizqbz
author: mxfwzzwizqbz
content: I don't care what you guys change it to, you can change it to Michael23913 or something like that but please I just want to remove my last name from my account. I don't want my full name on this thing lmao

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: If you want to change your name, you have to PM theymos, the admin of the forum. Usually, he doesn't allow changing username unless you can convince him with a reasonable excuse. Good luck.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on February 20, 2023, 07:30:07 AMIf you want to change your name, you have to PM theymos, the admin of the forum. Usually, he doesn't allow changing username unless you can convince him with a reasonable excuse. Good luck.I don't know if newbie who has 20 posts and 14 activity who probably hasn't made any major contributions to the forum can convince an admin to change the username. But there's nothing wrong with trying, even The Skeptical Chymist had to wait quite while for it to be approved to change its username from The Pharmacist.I don't think it's the admin's fault if not accepting a user's request to change their username, but for some plausible reason I think it will be considered.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Since you created that account yesterday, wouldn't it be easier to just abandon it and create a new one instead? Its not like you put much effort into it so you would lose something.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Mate just create a new account. You only have like 20 posts. Historically, Theymos only changed the username of accounts that have been registered for years, and that have been contributing a good amount. The chances of your username getting changed is slim.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: I would suggest that he gets a name change since that's a minor, a 16 years old teenager boy who has apparently consumed a lot of sugar having an outburst of energy. Please change the name @admin.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on February 20, 2023, 07:50:13 AMThe Skeptical Chymist had to wait quite while for it to be approved to change its username from The Pharmacist.From what I've seen, Admin can be faster when it's for privacy reasons. But even if OP's name gets changed, his name can always be found back later. Once it's on the internet, it can't be forgotten.Quote from: Rikafip on February 20, 2023, 07:58:00 AMwouldn't it be easier to just abandon it and create a new one instead?That would really break the link with OP's current account.

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: Quote from: theymos on August 28, 2011, 11:16:31 PMDone. Now only moderators, Donators, and VIP members can change their names automatically. Other members should contact me. I'll probably ignore your request if you have less than 50 posts (unless your posts are very good).Quote from: hilariousandco on January 06, 2020, 10:38:23 AMYou can't. You can try PM an admin and they may do it, but they usually don't. You can just create another account¬† with that name if you feel like you need it.If you are not VIP or Donator member, you can not change your username.Admin can change your username without VIP or donator member condition if he sees you have good reasons for your privacy, dox or something dangerous to you.

comments.author: imamusma
comments.body: Quote from: mxfwzzwizqbz on February 20, 2023, 07:27:31 AMI don't care what you guys change it to, you can change it to Michael23913 or something like that but please I just want to remove my last name from my account. I don't want my full name on this thing lmaoYour login or username can only be changed by an admin, so try contacting them for change request. Then for your other thread: Deletion of my account, imo the account deletion act is also only handled by the admin and if you are really concerned about your privacy then contact them ASAP and explain what the problem is. Good luck.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on February 20, 2023, 07:50:13 AMeven The Skeptical Chymist had to wait quite while for it to be approved to change its username from The Pharmacist.Just to clarify, Theymos implied in his PM to me that I didn't need to wait nearly as long as I did before he granted my name change (which was over 2 years I think).¬† He told me I should have been more persistent in reminding him, which I basically just did none of.But to OP here, I'm thinking that just deleting all of his posts and creating a new profile should do the trick.¬† That name is common enough that I doubt anyone is going to associate the person behind it with the bitcointalk account.¬† Theymos might grant his request, but I'm not sure he does name changes for trivial reasons.

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on February 20, 2023, 08:39:35 AMJust to clarify, Theymos implied in his PM to me that I didn't need to wait nearly as long as I did before he granted my name change (which was over 2 years I think).¬† He told me I should have been more persistent in reminding him, which I basically just did none of.I wonder though, why didn't he just change the name, rather than asking you to remind him later?

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on February 20, 2023, 08:39:35 AMJust to clarify, Theymos implied in his PM to me that I didn't need to wait nearly as long as I did before he granted my name change (which was over 2 years I think). ¬†He told me I should have been more persistent in reminding him, which I basically just did none of.Your case won't be as that of OP. You're not just a veteran member, you're also a reputable one. Expectedly and quite understandably too, theymos will have a soft spot for users like that. If it were any different, theymos may not even have given the pm a second thought. If I were the OP, I would just create a fresh account and abandon this vexatious one instead of going through the wait and stress of expecting that the moniker would be changed. However, it's surprising to me how anyone would include their surname to their moniker when it's not a professional career site/forum like we've in LinkedIn.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Mpamaegbu on February 20, 2023, 02:39:52 PM However, it's surprising to me how anyone would include their surname to their moniker when it's not a professional career site/forum like we've in LinkedIn.You're forgetting that the OP is still a child. He turns 16 on February 26th. He recently registered on the site, and we are already literally familiar with his entire history, including photos and videos. Likewise, he had previously been warned not to be so open, but the boy thought that deleting information from the forum by deleting his account would be a very simple matter. Apparently, when he decided to do this, something went wrong.How often do we see such stories when our children can foolishly tell everyone about us, everything that we have hidden for years? The naivety of children, even if they are 16 years old, can play a trick on them in the future. Probably, the dangers of the network should be explained as soon as the child gets a bottle of milk in his mouth.

comments.author: aylabadia05

Moreover, the age has not reached 1 week.My advice, it is better if you consider the input from Rikafip regarding your wishes.Quote from: Rikafip on February 20, 2023, 07:58:00 AMSince you created that account yesterday, wouldn't it be easier to just abandon it and create a new one instead?
